content: Hi. I just wanted to start a coordination topic for Russian language translations.

Not sure what is the best way to translate "type ArcString = Arc<String> не создает, который можно было бы использовать как let as = ArcString::new()". It's one the answers to the question "What do you feel are the biggest challenges or problems for the Rust project? What could we do to improve adoption?"

According to DeepL:

type ArcString = Arc<String> does not create one that could be used as = ArcString::new().

I suspect Yerkebulan Tulibergenov is asking how to form a more general question out of that hypothetical snippet. Something like: can an Arc counted reference automatically inherit all properties of Arc<T>?
(not sure what I am saying because I'm not too familiar with that)

but me neither I understand what the commenter is exactly asking :thinking: I would probably rephrase in something more general such as "improve ergonomics of ref. counted pointers" or something along that ... :shrug:
@Ludwig Stecher I speak Russian myself, but I can't make sense of what they are trying to say in order to translate it into English.
Does the following make sense? "You can't create type ArcString = Arc<String>. It would have been possible to use it like let as = ArcString::new()"
Yeah, I guess that's what they meant. I will go with that.

@Yerkebulan Tulibergenov Not a Russian speaker, but (based on the machine translation) what I think they meant is that functions can't be called on type aliases (which is actually wrong: You can call ArcString::new() when there is a type ArcString = Arc<String>;).
I think they referred to type alias rather than a function on it. Thanks for playground link. I am glad we support it :)
Hey all - Is the Russian translation finished? If not, do you have an idea when it will be? The hope was to have it finished by today, but I understand if that didn't work out.
@Ryan Levick Last time I checked, it was almost ready. I will do my best to finish it today.

Ryan Levick said:

Hey all - Is the Russian translation finished? If not, do you have an idea when it will be? The hope was to have it finished by today, but I understand if that didn't work out.

My raw estimation is to finish on that week or up to beginning of next week. There are 455 surveys (second result after English survey with 6_000<). We are on good track, but there are still quite many answers to translate (3 columns with custom answers).

Thanks for the update. Please do keep me in the loop on your progress. We can start by processing the other translations, but we'll want to get started with analysis ASAP and we can't do that until we have Russian. :blush:
The translation from Russian is done! :tada: Thank you to everyone who helped out!
@Ryan Levick To make sure you see this ^^^
